verses.roman:
tam ānarcātithiṁ bhūpaḥ
pratyutthānāsanārhaṇaiḥ
yayāce 'bhyavahārāya
pāda-mūlam upāgataḥ

synonyms: tam—unto him (Durvāsā); ānarca—worshiped; atithim—although an uninvited guest; bhūpaḥ—the King (Ambarīṣa); pratyutthāna—by standing up; āsana—by offering a seat; arhaṇaiḥ—and by paraphernalia for worship; yayāce—requested; abhyavahārāya—for eating; pāda-mūlam—at the root of his feet; upāgataḥ—fell down.
translation: After standing up to receive Durvāsā Muni, King Ambarīṣa offered him a seat and paraphernalia of worship. Then, sitting at his feet, the King requested the great sage to eat.
